Posts.Content: njboo11 wrote: I was diagnosed with BC in 2002.  Was in remission for 5 years, then tumor markers rose, found 1 lone spot on the liver-had a liver resection, which bought me a year.  Now for the past 2 years, I have battled with recurrent tumors on liver.  I was on Xeloda for one year, and it was fantastic, but then stopped working.  Now my markers are on the rise, and a CAT scan confirmed continually growing tumors.  I have my port put back in and am starting Adriamyacin....I am sooooo sad about all this.  I want to get better, but don't want to lose hair, be sickly, etc, because I am so incredibly active.  I work 2 jobs and do photography on the side.  But the tumors are getting larger to where I can tell because I have pain after eating.  I am only 42, have 4 children and one grandchild, and I want to fight, but don't know when to say enough is enough.....because there is no saying this med will even work.  Anyone else been on it for liver mets?  He is starting me off with low dose and one drug to preserve my QOL.  Anyone in general feel like I do, when to say, ENOUGH? Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2010 08:49AM njboo11 wrote: Thanks everyone for your posts!  The Adrimyacin is so far treating my body kindly, so I am forever happy about this!  Won't know if it is working for a month or so.  Someone asked on liver resection.  I had that done in Feb of 2008 because i had one lone tumor on my liver.  It kept me in remission for exactly 1 year before my tumor markers rose, then there were multiple tumors on the liver.  It is a very long (6 hours) surgery and very hard recovery.......if I would have known they would come back I would  not have had it, I would have opted for chemo to kill that lone tumor.  But, hindsite is 20/20.
